definition.name: Badge
definition.purpose: Display a styled badge element with variant-based appearance
definition.description: A reusable UI component for rendering a badge with different visual variants (default, secondary, destructive, outline). Supports custom class names, asChild rendering, and all span props. Used to highlight or label content in the interface.

className.description: Additional CSS classes to apply to the badge

variant.description: Visual style of the badge. One of: default, secondary, destructive, outline

asChild.description: If true, renders the badge as a child component using Slot

initial.data: Badge with default or specified variant and content

visible: A styled badge element with text or children
enabled: All span props, variant selection, asChild rendering

effects: Badge appearance updates to match the new variant

when.description: The asChild prop is set to true

effects: Badge is rendered as a child of another component using Slot

definition.visualLayout: Inline-flex badge with rounded corners, border, and variant-based background and text color. Can contain icons or text.
definition.implementationNotes: Uses class-variance-authority for variant styling, supports forwarding all span props, and can render as a Slot for advanced composition.

declarations.name: badgeVariants
declarations.description: A utility function created with class-variance-authority (cva) to generate class names for the Badge component based on the selected variant. Supports 'default', 'secondary', 'destructive', and 'outline' variants, with 'default' as the default.

variant.description: The visual variant of the badge. One of: default, secondary, destructive, outline.

returns.description: A string of CSS class names for the badge element.

declarations.implementationNotes: Uses cva from class-variance-authority to manage conditional class names for the Badge component.
